3.14.1.title: Philosophy
3.14.1.content:
**Objective:**
Maintain well control equipment in ready condition at all times.

**Approach:**
- Preventive maintenance to prevent failures
- Corrective maintenance to fix issues found
- Condition-based maintenance where appropriate

**Priority:**
Well control equipment maintenance takes priority over other maintenance activities. Never defer critical well control maintenance.

3.14.2.title: BOP Maintenance
3.14.2.content:
**Routine:**
- Visual inspection during operations
- Seal and packer condition monitoring
- Hydraulic system checks
- Control system verification

**Periodic:**
- Ram packer replacement (per manufacturer or condition)
- Annular element replacement (per cycles/wear)
- Complete overhaul (per OEM schedule)
- Recertification (per regulatory requirements)

**Records:**
- Track all maintenance performed
- Log seal and packer changes
- Document test results
- Maintain equipment history

3.14.3.title: Accumulator Maintenance
3.14.3.content:
**Daily:**
- Check reservoir fluid level
- Verify system pressure
- Check for leaks

**Weekly:**
- Test pumps operation
- Verify pre-charge pressure (sample bottles)
- Check accumulator performance per test

**Periodic:**
- Full pre-charge verification (all bottles)
- Pump servicing
- Valve and seal replacement
- Fluid change if contaminated

3.14.4.title: Choke and Manifold Maintenance
3.14.4.content:
**Regular:**
- Operate all valves to prevent seizing
- Check for erosion (especially after use)
- Verify choke operation through range
- Inspect instrumentation

**After Use:**
- Inspect choke trim for erosion
- Replace if worn
- Check valve seats
- Pressure test if opened for service

**Spares:**
- Keep critical spares on location
- Choke trim kits
- Valve parts
- Gaskets and seals

3.14.5.title: Pit and Flow Monitoring
3.14.5.content:
**Sensors:**
- Calibrate regularly
- Clean sensor elements
- Replace failed sensors promptly
- Test alarm functions

**Display/Recording:**
- Verify display accuracy
- Check recorder function
- Ensure alarms audible/visible
- Back up data regularly

3.14.6.title: Spare Parts
3.14.6.content:
**Critical Spares on Location:**
- BOP seal kits
- Annular element
- Choke trim
- Accumulator bottles (pre-charged)
- Control system components
- Gaskets and O-rings

**Inventory Management:**
- Track usage and stock levels
- Reorder before depletion
- Store properly (protect seals from heat/UV)
- Rotate stock (use oldest first)

**Critical Parts:**
- Some parts may have long lead times
- Identify critical items
- Ensure availability or backup plan

3.14.7.title: Maintenance Records
3.14.7.content:
**Document:**
- All maintenance performed
- Parts replaced
- Tests after maintenance
- Identified issues and resolution

**Purpose:**
- Equipment history tracking
- Regulatory compliance
- Planning future maintenance
- Warranty documentation

**Retention:**
- Per regulatory requirements
- Typically life of equipment plus years
- Available for inspection
